Package hmg.car.ccsaccount

Class CcsAccountConstants

java.lang.Object
hmg.car.ccsaccount.CcsAccountConstants
public final class CcsAccountConstants extends Object
This class defines the constants related to CCS account functionality. These constants are used to identify account types, token types, and action intents for the CCS account system.

Constants include:

  • ACCOUNT_TYPE: The type of CCS account.
  • ACTION_ACCOUNT_READY_ON_BOOT_COMPLETED: Action triggered when the account is ready on boot completion.

Usage Examples:

To add a CCS account to the Android AccountManager:

     Account account = new Account("user@example.com", CcsAccountConstants.ACCOUNT_TYPE);
     AccountManager accountManager = AccountManager.get(context);
     accountManager.addAccountExplicitly(account, "password", null);

To get an authentication token:

     String authToken = accountManager.peekAuthToken(account, CcsAccountConstants.AUTH_TOKEN_TYPE);

To trigger an action when the account is ready after boot:

     Intent intent = new Intent(CcsAccountConstants.ACTION_ACCOUNT_READY_ON_BOOT_COMPLETED);
     context.sendBroadcast(intent);

  • Method Details

    • exampleGetAccountsByType

      public static void exampleGetAccountsByType(android.content.Context context)
      Example usage of the AccountManager's `getAccountsByType()` method using the constant `ACCOUNT_TYPE`.

      Example:

           AccountManager accountManager = AccountManager.get(context);
     Account[] accounts = accountManager.getAccountsByType(CcsAccountConstants.ACCOUNT_TYPE);

      This will return all accounts of type CcsAccountConstants.ACCOUNT_TYPE.

      Parameters:
      context - The context used to access the AccountManager.

    • exampleGetUserData

      public static void exampleGetUserData(android.content.Context context, android.accounts.Account account)
      Example usage of the AccountManager's `getUserData()` method to retrieve data associated with an account.

      Example:

           String authToken = accountManager.getUserData(account, CcsAccountConstants.AUTH_TOKEN_TYPE);

      This retrieves the user data associated with the given account, for example the authentication token.

      Parameters:
      context - The context used to access the AccountManager.
      account - The account from which to retrieve user data.

    • exampleAddOnAccountsUpdatedListener

      public static void exampleAddOnAccountsUpdatedListener(android.content.Context context)
      Example usage of the AccountManager's `addOnAccountsUpdatedListener()` method to listen for account updates.

      Example:

           accountManager.addOnAccountsUpdatedListener(new OnAccountsUpdateListener() {
         public void onAccountsUpdated(Account[] accounts) {
             // Handle account updates
         }
     }, null, true);

      This listener will notify when accounts are updated. You can filter by account type using CcsAccountConstants.ACCOUNT_TYPE.

      Parameters:
      context - The context used to access the AccountManager.

    • exampleGetAuthToken

      public static void exampleGetAuthToken(android.content.Context context, android.accounts.Account account, android.app.Activity activity)
      Example usage of the AccountManager's `getAuthToken()` method to retrieve an authentication token.

      Example:

           accountManager.getAuthToken(account, CcsAccountConstants.AUTH_TOKEN_TYPE, null, activity, new AccountManagerCallback<Bundle>() {
         public void run(AccountManagerFuture<Bundle> future) {
             try {
                 Bundle bundle = future.getResult();
                 String authToken = bundle.getString(AccountManager.KEY_AUTHTOKEN);
             } catch (Exception e) {
                 e.printStackTrace();
             }
         }
     }, null);

      This retrieves the authentication token for the specified account.

      Parameters:
      context - The context used to access the AccountManager.
      account - The account for which to retrieve the auth token.
      activity - The activity used to handle the callback.

    • exampleInvalidateAuthToken

      public static void exampleInvalidateAuthToken(android.content.Context context, String authToken)
      Example usage of the AccountManager's `invalidateAuthToken()` method to invalidate an authentication token.

      Example:

           accountManager.invalidateAuthToken(CcsAccountConstants.ACCOUNT_TYPE, authToken);

      This invalidates the authentication token for the specified account type.

      Parameters:
      context - The context used to access the AccountManager.
      authToken - The authentication token to invalidate.
